Key Match Events: Tristan da Silva recorded a career-best 25 points and was 5-for-7 on 3-point attempts
Orlando made 19 3-pointers to control the game most of the way
Suggs twisted awkwardly as he fell with 3:06 to play in the second quarter and left the court in a wheelchair
Barnes scored the first five points of the fourth quarter to cut the lead to 15
Ja’Kobe Walter’s trey further sliced the gap to nine with 6:04 to go
Anthony scored seven straight points and Orlando led by 17 with 2:03 to play
Post-Match Reflections: He's definitely not getting enough recognition as a rookie
Toronto’s RJ Barrett (illness) and Orlando’s Anthony Black (back) did not play
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jakob Poeltl scored 25 points for the Raptors
Scottie Barnes added 20 points and nine rebounds
Immanuel Quickley had 11 points and 11 assists
Orlando opened a 19-point lead when Caldwell-Pope made a layup off a feed from Anthony with 7:40 remaining in the third quarter
Bitadze’s dunk increased the lead to 21 with 4:25 left in the quarter
The margin increased to 22 when Trevelin Queen hit a 3-pointer
Orlando led 88-68 after the third quarter
